subject: RE: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... I don t understand this. In my experience, big projects ideally simply are be composed of more modules of a similar size than small project modules have,
messageBody:
> Are you suggesting that groupping test classes per fixture will be
> the only supported option in JUnit4?
>
> I'd say that this could be ok for small projects but for projects
> with thousands tests it will not make any easier to see all the tests
> for any changed class.

I don't understand this. In my experience, big projects ideally simply are
be composed of more modules of a similar size than small project modules
have, with a similar amount of packages, with a similar amount of classes
per package. And of course the classes shouldn't be bigger just because it's
a bigger project. So it shouldn't be harder to find the tests for a class in
a big project than it is in a small project, should it?

> Also note that it is also bad option to rerun
> all tests because there are too many of them to be runned on each
> change.

It should be at least possible to run all the tests of the whole module the
class belongs to. If those tests take too long for that, I'd worry about
either module size or test performance...

Just my 0.02...

Cheers, Ilja
